00044 /**
00045  * @brief Object to hold all prior information to constitute an EM seed 
00046  */
00047 class CEMSeed
00048 {
00049         friend class CPrimeEM;
00050 public:
00051         /**
00052         * @brief, the default constructor
00053         * @param clusters - number of clusters to cluster data into 
00054         */
00055         CEMSeed(const int clusters = 3); 
00056         /**
00057         * @brief set the number of cluters
00058         * @param clusters - number of clusters to cluster data into
00059         */
00060         void set(const int clusters = 3); 
00061         /**
00062         * @brief assignment operator
00063         */
00064         CEMSeed& operator = (const CEMSeed& rhs);
00065         /**
00066         * @brief equal operator
00067         */
00068         bool operator == (const CEMSeed& rhs);
00069         /**
00070         * @brief Set the centers of clusters assuming upto three clusters in total
00071         * @param c1 - center for the first cluster
00072         * @param c2 - center for the second cluster
00073         * @param c3 - center for the third cluster
00074         * @param c[] - array of centers of all clusters
00075         * @param c - vector of centers of all clusters
00076         */
00077         void setMu(const double c[], const int size = 3);
00078         void setMu(const double c1, const double c2,const double c3);
00079         void setMu(std::vector<double>& c);
00080         /**
00081         * @brief Set the minimum of centers of clusters assuming upto three clusters in total
00082         * @param c1 - minimum of center for the first cluster
00083         * @param c2 - minimum of center for the second cluster
00084         * @param c3 - minimum of center for the third cluster
00085         * @param c[] - array of minimum of centers for all clusters
00086         * @param c - vector of minimum of centers of all clusters
00087         */      
00088         void setMinMu(const double c[], const int size = 3);
00089         void setMinMu(const double c1,const double c2,const double c3);
00090         void setMinMu(std::vector<double>& c);
00091         /**
00092         * @brief Set the maximum of centers of clusters assuming upto three clusters in total
00093         * @param c1 - maximum of center for the first cluster
00094         * @param c2 - maximum of center for the second cluster
00095         * @param c3 - maximum of center for the third cluster
00096         * @param c[] - array of maximum of centers for all clusters
00097         * @param c - vector of maximum of centers of all clusters
00098         */      
00099         void setMaxMu(const double c[], const int size = 3);
00100         void setMaxMu(const double c1,const double c2,const double c3);
00101         void setMaxMu(std::vector<double>& c);
00102         /**
00103         * @brief Set the weight of clusters assuming upto three clusters in total
00104         * @param w1 - weight for the first cluster
00105         * @param w2 - weight of center for the second cluster
00106         * @param w3 - weight of center for the third cluster
00107         * @param w[] - array of weights for all clusters
00108         * @param w - vector of weights  of all clusters
00109         */      
00110         void setWeight(const double w[], const int size = 3);
00111         void setWeight(const double w1,const double w2,const double w3);
00112         void setWeight(std::vector<double>& w);
00113         /**
00114         * @brief Set the sigmas of clusters assuming upto three clusters in total
00115         * @param s1 - sigma for the first cluster
00116         * @param s2 - sigma for the second cluster
00117         * @param s3 - sigma for the third cluster
00118         * @param s[] - array of sigmas for all clusters
00119         * @param s - vector of sigmas of all clusters
00120         */              
00121         void setSigma(const double s[], const int size = 3);
00122         void setSigma(const double s1,const double s2,const double s3);
00123         void setSigma(std::vector<double>& s);
00124         /**
00125         * @brief Set the minimum of sigmas of clusters assuming upto three clusters in total
00126         * @param s1 - minimum of sigma for the first cluster
00127         * @param s2 - minimum of sigma for the second cluster
00128         * @param s3 - minimum of sigma for the third cluster
00129         * @param s[] - array of minimum sigmas for all clusters
00130         * @param s - vector of minimum sigmas of all clusters
00131         */              
00132         void setMinSigma(const double s[], const int size = 3);
00133         void setMinSigma(const double s1,const double s2,const double s3);
00134         void setMinSigma(std::vector<double>& s);
00135         /**
00136         * @brief Set the maximum of sigmas of clusters assuming upto three clusters in total
00137         * @param s1 - maximum of sigma for the first cluster
00138         * @param s2 - maximum of sigma for the second cluster
00139         * @param s3 - maximum of sigma for the third cluster
00140         * @param s[] - array of maximum sigmas for all clusters
00141         * @param s - vector of maximum sigmas of all clusters
00142         */      
00143         void setMaxSigma(const double s[], const int size = 3);
00144         void setMaxSigma(const double s1,const double s2,const double s3);
00145         void setMaxSigma(std::vector<double>& s);
00146         /** 
00147         * @brief get functions to all member variables
00148         * @return the contents of member variables
00149         */
00150         std::vector<double> getMu() { return m_mu; }
00151         std::vector<double> getSigma() {return m_sigma; }
00152         std::vector<double> getWeight() { return m_weight; }
00153         std::vector<double> getMinMu() { return m_minMu; }
00154         std::vector<double> getMinSigma() { return m_minSigma; }
00155         std::vector<double> getMaxMu() { return m_maxMu; }
00156         std::vector<double> getMaxSigma() { return m_maxSigma; }
00157 protected:
00158         // initial values for EM to start with
00159         /// centers of clusters
00160         std::vector<double> m_mu;
00161         /// sigmas of clusters
00162         std::vector<double> m_sigma;
00163         /// weights of clusters
00164         std::vector<double> m_weight;
00165 
00166         // constraints to restrict EM's move
00167         /// minimums of cluster centers
00168         std::vector<double> m_minMu;
00169         /// minimums of cluter sigmas
00170         std::vector<double> m_minSigma;
00171         /// maximums of cluster centers
00172         std::vector<double> m_maxMu;
00173         /// maximums of cluster sigmas
00174         std::vector<double> m_maxSigma;
00175 };

00177 /**
00178  * @brief Object to hold all EM posterior information including some classification quality stats
00179  */
00180 class CEMEst 
00181 {
00182         friend class CPrimeEM;
00183 public:
00184         /**
00185         * @brief, the default constructor
00186         * @param clusters - number of clusters to cluster data into 
00187         */
00188         CEMEst(const int clusters = 3); 
00189         /**
00190         * @brief set the number of cluters
00191         * @param clusters - number of clusters to cluster data into
00192         */
00193         void set(const int clusters = 3); 
00194         /**
00195         * @brief assignment operator
00196         */
00197         CEMEst& operator = (const CEMEst& rhs);
00198 protected:
00199         /**
00200         * @brief reset the buffer size for posterior information
00201         * @param dim - dimension of the data to be classified
00202         */
00203         void reset(const int dim);
00204 public:
00205         /// cluster centers
00206         std::vector<double> m_mu;
00207         /// cluster sigmas
00208         std::vector<double> m_sigma;
00209         /// cluster weights
00210         std::vector<double> m_weight;
00211         /// minimum of cluster centers
00212         std::vector<double> m_minMu;
00213         /// maximums of cluster centers
00214         std::vector<double> m_maxMu;
00215         /// minimums of cluster sigmas
00216         std::vector<double> m_minSigma;
00217         /// maximums of cluster sigmas
00218         std::vector<double> m_maxSigma;
00219         /// number of clusters remaining
00220         std::vector<bool> m_cluster;
00221         /// EM cluster member assignment
00222         std::vector<int> m_class;
00223         /// probability to best fit cluster
00224         std::vector<double> m_prob;
00225         /// probability ratio, best vs. second best
00226         std::vector<double> m_probRatio;
00227         /// genotype confidence
00228         std::vector<double> m_confidence;
00229         /// total maximum likelihood
00230         double m_ML;
00231         // QC metrices, Fisher's linear discriminants
00232         /// Fisher's linear discriminant of the first two clusters
00233         double m_FLD1;
00234         /// Fisher's linear discriminant of the second two clusters
00235         double m_FLD2;
00236         /// separation of the clustering results
00237         double m_sep;
00238 };

00240 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00241 // compare two pairs based only on first value
00242 struct PairLess : public std::binary_function<std::pair<double,int>,std::pair<double,int>,bool>
00243 {
00244         bool operator () (const std::pair<double,int>& x, const std::pair<double,int>& y) const
00245         {
00246                 return (x.first < y.first);
00247         }
00248 };

00250 /**
00251 * @brief different loss function options
00252 */
00253 typedef enum {
00254         ML=1,
00255         AIC=2,
00256         BIC=4,
00257         BIC_SEP=8
00258 } LOSSFUNC;

00260         /**
00261  * @brief Object to hold all EM parameters
00262  */
00263 class CEMParam
00264 {
00265 public:
00266         /**
00267         * @brief defualt constructor
00268         * @param clusters - number of clusters
00269         */
00270         CEMParam(const int clusters = 3); 
00271         /**
00272         * @brief assignment operator
00273         */
00274         CEMParam& operator = (const CEMParam& rhs);
00275 public:
00276         /// maximum number of clusters
00277         int m_nClusters;
00278         /// maximum number of iterations
00279         int m_nMaxIter;
00280         /// tolerance for insignificant change for convergence
00281         double m_fTolerance;
00282         /// to where we place the non-Gaussian tail
00283         double m_tailCut;
00284         /// flag to indicate weight is used or not
00285         bool m_useWeight;
00286         /// factor to balance the weights in confidence of probability and loglikelihood ratio
00287         double m_factor;
00288         /// parameter used for seed generation
00289         double m_delta;
00290         /// parameter used for seed generation
00291         double m_epsilon;
00292         /// the loss function to be used for EM evaluation
00293         LOSSFUNC m_lossFunction;
00294         /// the threshold to drop a cluster if total number of data points is less
00295         double m_clusterDropThres;
00296         /// the threshold on EM's confidence
00297         double m_threshold;
00298         /// factor for hom cluster variance shrinkage
00299         double m_HomReductionCoef;
00300         /// factor for het cluster variance shrinkage
00301         double m_HetReductionCoef;
00302         /// factor for both hom and het cluster variance shrinkage
00303         double m_SigmaPower;
00304     // factors to check if any cluster std have gone above x times of geometric mean of all stds
00305     std::vector<double> m_geo_ratio_multiplier;
00306     // factors to check if any cluster std have gone below x times of geometric mean of all stds
00307     std::vector<double> m_geo_ratio_divisor;
00308 };

00310 /**
00311  * @brief Object to hold all EM prior information
00312  */
00313 class CEMPrior
00314 {
00315         friend class CPrimeEM;
00316 public:
00317         /**
00318         * @brief defualt constructor
00319         * @param clusters - number of clusters
00320         */
00321         CEMPrior(const int clusters = 3);
00322         /**
00323         * @brief initialize prior information with defaults if clusters=3
00324         * @return void
00325         */
00326         void initialize();
00327         /**
00328         * @brief set function to initialize buffers
00329         * @param clusters - number of clusters
00330         * @return void
00331         */
00332         void set(const int clusters = 3); 
00333         /**
00334         * @brief assignment operator
00335         */
00336         CEMPrior& operator = (const CEMPrior& rhs);
00337         /**
00338         * @brief function to set up the centers of clusters
00339         * @param c - a vector to hold all centers of clusters
00340         * @return void
00341         */
00342         void setMu(const std::vector<double>& c);
00343         /**
00344         * @brief function to set up the stdev of cluster centers
00345         * @param c - a vector to hold all centers of clusters
00346         * @return void
00347         */
00348         void setMuSD(const std::vector<double>& c);
00349         /**
00350         * @brief function to set up the sigmas of clusters
00351         * @param s - a vector to hold all of stdevs of clusters
00352         * @return void
00353         */
00354         void setSigma(const std::vector<double>& s);
00355         /**
00356         * @brief function to set up the centers of clusters
00357         * @param s - a vector to hold all stdevs of sigmas
00358         * @return void
00359         */
00360         void setSigmaSD(const std::vector<double>& s);
00361         /** 
00362         * @brief function to set the prior status, 
00363         *               must set true with valid information to proceed if initialzie()
00364         *               not called
00365         * @param good - flag to indicate the prior information status
00366         * @return void
00367         */
00368         inline void setStatus(bool good) { m_good = good; }
00369 protected:
00370         /// prior status
00371         bool m_good;
00372         /// cluster centers
00373         std::vector<double> m_mu;
00374         /// stdev of cluster centers
00375         std::vector<double> m_muSD;
00376         /// cluster sigmas
00377         std::vector<double> m_sigma;
00378         /// stdev of cluster sigmas
00379         std::vector<double> m_sigmaSD;
00380 };

00382 /**
00383  * @brief The primary class to hold all EM operations
00384  */
00385 class CPrimeEM
00386 {
00387 public:
00388         /**
00389         * @brief default constructor
00390         * @param clusters - number of clusters
00391         */
00392         CPrimeEM(); 
00393         /**
00394         * @brief generate variable number of EM seeds based on some prior information
00395         *               this function is designed specifically for 3-clusters scenario, hence only 
00396         *               works if three-clusters is specified, otherwise return false and do nothing
00397         * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00398         */
00399         bool generateEmpiricalEMSeeds();
00400         /**
00401         * @brief The function to run EM for genotyping, function only works for three cluster cases
00402         * @return true if there is no error, false otherwise
00403         */
00404         bool goPrimeEM();
00405         /**
00406         * @brief the function to get EM's estimate with a specific initial seed
00407         * @param seed - the specific initial seed
00408         * @return true if there is no error, false otherwise
00409         */
00410         bool EMEstimate(CEMSeed& seed);
00411         /**
00412         * @brief get to posterior
00413         */
00414         inline CEMEst* getEMEstimates() { return &m_est;}
00415         /**
00416         * @brief get seeds generated by generateEmpiricalEMSeeds()
00417         * @return void
00418         */
00419         inline std::vector<CEMSeed> getSeeds() { return m_seeds; }
00420         /**
00421         * @brief reset the data dimension
00422         * @param dim - data dimenstion
00423         * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00424         */
00425         bool reset(const int dim);
00426         /**
00427         * @brief set the data to be classified
00428         * @param x - the data to be classified
00429         * @return void
00430         */
00431         void setData(const std::vector<double>& x); 
00432         /** 
00433         * @brief set the prior information
00434         * @param prior - the prior information
00435         * @return void
00436         */
00437         inline void setPrior(const CEMPrior& prior){ m_prior = prior;}
00438         /** 
00439         * @brief set EM parameters
00440         * @param param - the parameters
00441         * @return void
00442         */
00443         void setParam(const CEMParam& param);
00444         /**
00445         * @brief check integrety of settings
00446         * @return true if settings are valid and consistent, false otherwise
00447         */
00448         bool checkPrior();
00449         /**
00450         * @brief confidence threshold set function, for backward compatibility
00451         */
00452         void setThreshold(const double thresh) { m_param.m_threshold = thresh; }
00453 
00454 public:
00455         /// the data to be classified
00456         std::vector<double> m_data;
00457         /**
00458         * @brief the Expectation step of EM algorithm
00459         * @param final - flag to indicate it's step to calculate posterior
00460         * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00461         */
00462         bool doEstep(bool final=false);
00463         /**
00464         * @brief the Maximization step of EM algorithm
00465         * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00466         */
00467         bool doMstep();
00468         /** 
00469         * @brief check the convergence status
00470         * @param it - current iteration
00471         * @return true if not converged, false otherwise
00472         */
00473         bool checkStatus(const int it);
00474         /**
00475         * @brief compute all posterior estimates
00476         * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00477         */
00478         bool computeOptimalEstimates();
00479         /**
00480         * @brief compare the current estimates to the best by far
00481         * @param bestEst - best estimates so far
00482         * @return true if current is better
00483         */
00484         bool evaluateEstimates(CEMEst& bestEst);
00485         /**
00486         * @brief roll back to the initial values
00487         * @param seed - the seed which contains the initial info to roll back to
00488         * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00489         */
00490         bool useInitialEstimate(CEMSeed& seed);
00491 
00492         /**
00493         * @brief update cluster centers 
00494         * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00495         */
00496         bool updateMu();
00497         /**
00498         * @brief update cluster variances 
00499         * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00500         */
00501         bool updateSigma();
00502         /**
00503         * @brief update cluster weights 
00504         * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00505         */
00506         bool updateWeight();
00507         /**
00508         * @brief adjust cluster centers according to constraints
00509         * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00510         */
00511         bool adjustMu();
00512         /**
00513         * @brief adjust cluster variances according to constraints
00514         * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00515         */
00516         bool adjustSigma();
00517         /**
00518         * @brief validate and adjust seed according to constraints
00519         * @param seed - the seed to be adjusted and returned after adjustment
00520         * @return true if no error, false otherwise
00521         */
00522         bool validate(CEMSeed& seed);
00523         // general functions
00524         /**
00525         * @brief initialize the type and likelihood pair vector, assign likelihood to infinity
00526         * @param typeLikelihoodPair - the type and likelihood pair vector to be initialized
00527         * @return void
00528         */
00529         void initializeTypeLikelihoodPair(std::vector<std::pair<double,int> >& typeLikelihoodPair);
00530         /**
00531         * @brief assign likelihood to each cluster for data point i
00532         * @param typeLikelihoodPair - the type and likelihood pair container
00533         * @param i - data point index
00534         * @return void
00535         */
00536         void assignLogLikelihood(std::vector<std::pair<double,int> >& typeLikelihoodPair, const int i);
00537         /**
00538         * @brief compute Fisher's Linear discrimants
00539         *                only computed if clusters are 2 or three
00540         * @param FLD1 - FLD for the first two clusters
00541         * @param FLD2 - FLD for the second two clusters
00542         * @return void
00543         */
00544         void computeFLD();
00545         /**
00546         * @brief assign class membership and associated confidence to data point i
00547         * @param typeLikelihoodPair - the type and likelihood pair container
00548         * @param i - data point index
00549         * @return void
00550         */      
00551         void assignClassAndConfidence(const int i, std::vector<std::pair<double,int> >& typeLikelihoodPair);
00552         /**
00553         * @brief adjust class membership and associated confidence to data point i
00554         * @param i - data point index
00555         * @return void
00556         */      
00557         void adjustClassAndConfidence(const int i);
00558 
00559 public:
00560         /// container of probabilities
00561         std::vector<std::vector<double> > m_p;
00562         /// container of normalized probabilities
00563         std::vector<std::vector<double> > m_np;
00564         /// container of total cluster probabilities
00565         std::vector<double> m_clusterP;
00566         /// container of total cluster normalized probabilities
00567         std::vector<double> m_clusterNP;
00568         /// container of total probabilities
00569         double m_sumNP;
00570         /// current estimates
00571         CEMEst m_est;
00572         /// pointer to the current seed in use
00573         CEMSeed* m_pSeed;
00574 protected:
00575         /// number of data points
00576         int m_nDim;
00577         /// parameter to the scale of FLD penalty of a classification, calculated from m_nDim on the fly
00578         double m_lamda;
00579         /// container to hold all EM seeds 
00580         std::vector<CEMSeed> m_seeds;
00581         /// the generic prior, kept in the level to be adjustable case specific intead of generic
00582         CEMPrior m_prior;
00583         /// EM parameters
00584         CEMParam m_param;
00585         /// best estimates so far
00586         CEMEst m_preEst;
00587 };

00589 /**
00590 * Utility function to calculate value from Gaussian function 
00591 * with an exponential tail
00592 * @param z - the z value
00593 * @param zCut - where the exponential part starts
00594 * @param factor - a scale factor
00595 * @return the value of z
00596 */
00597 double calcProbability(const double x,const double mu,const double sigma,const double weight,const double zCut,bool useWeight=false);
00598 /**
00599 * Utility function to calculate probability from Gaussian distibution 
00600 * with an exponential tail given the mean and standard deviation
00601 *
00602 * @param x - the observation
00603 * @param mu - mean of the gaussian distribution
00604 * @param sigma - standard deviation of the gaussian distribution
00605 * @param weight - the weight
00606 * @param zCut - where the exponential part starts
00607 * @param useWeight - flag to indicate whether weight should be used or not
00608 * @return the probability of x from the given Gaussian distribution
00609 */
00610 double calcGaussianWithExpTail(const double z,const double zCut,const double factor=1) ;
